noun.description: A shrub or small tree of the buckthorn family, typically bearing thorns. Some kinds yield dyes, and others have been used medicinally.
A shrub or small tree of the sapodilla family, with sharp thorns and clusters of small white flowers, commonly found in moist soils of the southern and central US.

origin: Late 16th century: from buck in the sense deer + thorn, translating modern Latin spina cervina.
